channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Will the U.S. elections impact crypto markets? Insiders weigh in
item.description: Crypto insiders on Wednesday downplayed the importance of of the U.S. presidential race on the market at the annual TOKEN2049 event in Singapore.

item.title: An aggressive Fed move is unlikely to spur a surprise Bank of England rate cut
item.description: Money market pricing for a BOE cut at Thursday's September meeting dipped from 35% late Tuesday to 26% Wednesday morning

item.title: Taiwan manufacturer rejects links to Lebanon's exploding pager attacks, names Hungarian firm
item.description: The company said that the design and manufacturing of the pagers were handled by a Hungary-based company called BAC.

item.title: Novartis not joining the 'frenzy' of weight loss drugs, CEO says
item.description: Swiss pharmaceutical giant Novartis said Wednesday that it does not plan to enter into the "frenzy" of weight loss drugs.

item.title: Google wins court challenge to the EU's $1.7 billion antitrust fine over ad product
item.description: The European Union's second-highest court on Wednesday said a 1.5 billion euro ($1.7 billion) antitrust fine imposed on Google by regulators should be annulled.

item.title: Ray Dalio names the top five forces shaping the global economy
item.description: Speaking at the Milken Institute's Asia Summit in Singapore, the founder of Bridgewater Associates said the five factors are interrelated and often cyclical.

item.title: UK inflation holds steady in August, matching expectations
item.description: U.K. inflation came in at 2.2% for the month of August, data from the Office for National Statistics showed Wednesday.

item.title: This 38-year-old is financially independent with passive income. Here's how he built a 7-figure real estate portfolio
item.description: Shu Matsuo Post, 38, has reached financial independence after building a seven-figure real estate portfolio. Today, he lives in Japan with his wife and kids.

item.title: Japan faces labor shortages and demographic crisis as elderly population hits record high
item.description: Japan's number of people aged 65 and over has reached a record high, cementing it as the worlds most elderly country, according to government statistics.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Hoping for a 50-basis-point cut
item.description: Hope versus reality: That’s the mood among market watchers as we count down to the Fed’s interest rate decision.

item.title: Oil stares at a bleak future as China's economy sputters. The good news: A market 'bust' is unlikely
item.description: Lower oil prices were the dominant theme in Asia's largest oil conference. The question was not whether oil will go lower, but mostly by how much will it decline in the coming years.

item.title: Trump says he will meet with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi next week
item.description: Modi will partake in the fourth Quad Leaders' Summit in Wilmington, Delaware and attend the United Nations General Assembly in New York.

item.title: These are the '50 best hotels' in the world for 2024
item.description: Capella Bangkok is 2024's 'best' hotel in the world, according to a new ranking by the 50 Best organization.

item.title: Harris victory seen as most likely election outcome, according to CNBC Fed Survey
item.description: The survey was taken several days after the first and possibly only debate between Vice President Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

item.title: Microsoft, BlackRock form group to raise $100 billion to invest in AI data centers and power
item.description: Microsoft, BlackRock and Abu Dhabi's investment vehicle are aiming to initially raise $30 billion to invest in AI data centers and the energy to power them.

item.title: The Bank of Japan's next rate hike may come in December, not this week: CNBC survey
item.description: CNBC surveyed economists, FX strategists and Japan-focused fund managers on their BOJ expectations and year-end forecast for the yen.

item.title: Harris-Trump election has Big Tech 'at a crossroads' after slump in dealmaking
item.description: With regulators making it hard for large tech companies to do significant deals, M&A transaction volume in the industry continues to drop.

item.title: China seeks a homegrown alternative to Nvidia — these are some of the companies to watch
item.description: Some of China's giants inclduing Huawei, Alibaba and Baidu are among those trying to create alternative semiconductor tech to Nvidia.

item.title: Apple is in talks with JPMorgan for bank to take over card from Goldman Sachs
item.description: While the talks are early and could falter, the move could mean that the country's largest credit card issuer may grow even larger.

item.title: Trump Media shares sink more than 6% two days before merger 'lockup' period ends
item.description: Former President Donald Trump on Friday said he will not sell his stake in Trump Media, which owns the Republican's preferred social media app, Truth Social.

item.title: FanDuel parent Flutter looks for international growth with big acquisitions in Italy, Brazil
item.description: Flutter is making acquisitions in Italy and Brazil as the British parent company of FanDuel looks to international markets for growth.

item.title: The Apple Watch Series 10 offers mostly minor upgrades, but faster charging is a big plus
item.description: There are lots of refinements to the new Apple Watch Series 10 such as a bigger screen, faster charging and new polished titanium models.

item.title: Bitcoin climbs above $60,000 ahead of Fed rate decision
item.description: Bitcoin reclaimed $60,000 on Tuesday as investors awaited details on the Federal Reserve's rate cutting plans.

item.title: Snap unveils latest AR glasses despite ongoing struggles in core ad business
item.description: Snap on Tuesday announced the fifth generation of its Spectacles augmented reality glasses, despite its core business continuing to struggle.

item.title: Big AI models will be commoditized — the value will come from the applications, Infosys chair says
item.description: Nandan Nilekani, co-founder of Infosys, said there are going to many different large language models around the world.

item.title: Alaska closes $1.9 billion acquisition of Hawaiian Airlines after DOT blessing
item.description: The two airlines can begin the process of closing their $1.9 billion merger.

item.title: China's ultra-rich population sees 'dramatic' growth in last 10 years, outpacing the U.S., report shows
item.description: The world's super rich club saw a significant expansion over the past 10 years, with China leading the charge, a report by Henley & Partners showed.

item.title: British e-commerce firm THG plans to spin off technology services arm, shares tumble
item.description: THG said it is "actively undertaking detailed work to review potential structures to facilitate the demerger of THG Ingenuity."

item.title: FDA clears Apple's sleep apnea detection feature for use. Here's how it works
item.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Monday cleared Apple's new sleep apnea detection feature for use.

item.title: Big names like David Tepper and 'Big Short' investor Michael Burry are quietly upping their bets on the Chinese economy
item.description: From property woes to sluggish economic data, China appears to be suffering from long Covid.
